article.description:
Romain Sato scored 24 points, including 18
in the second half, as Xavier defeated Massachusetts 86-73 on
Saturday.
article.headline: Xavier pulls away late from UMass to win
article.linkText: Sato heats up in second half to lead Xavier to win
article.story:
AMHERST, Mass. -- Romain Sato scored 24 points, including 18
in the second half, as (No. 23 ESPN/USA Today, unranked AP) Xavier defeated Massachusetts 86-73 on Saturday.

	   The Musketeers (12-4, 3-1 Atlantic 10) staged a 13-0 run early
in the second half, eventually building their lead to 18 points,
55-37.

	   Massachusetts (6-10, 0-4) came within seven at 78-71 with 1:42
to play, but Sato and Dedrick Finn followed with a pair of free
throws each to put Xavier in the clear.

	   Finn and David West both added 21 for Xavier. West also had 11
rebounds to lead the Musketeers to a 32-25 rebounding advantage.

	   Jackie Rogers went 6-of-7 from the field and 11-of-12 from the
line to lead the Minutemen with 23 points. Gabe Lee had 13.

	   Keenan Christiansen's 3-pointer at the end of the half gave
Xavier a 38-31 halftime lead.

	   Finn, who had three 3-pointers, got 11 points in the first half.

	   UMass freshman guard Michael Lasme was scheduled to have surgery
on a broken bone in his right wrist on Friday, but played on
Saturday after delaying the surgery until after the season.
